definition: to discuss
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: So the whole book makes up the three speeches Moses gave.
sentences.chinese: 所以整本書是由摩西的三篇講論組成。

sentences.english: The mouth of the virtuous utters wisdom and his tongue speaks of what is right.
sentences.chinese: 義人的口傾吐智慧，他的舌頭講論公義。

sentences.english: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
sentences.chinese: 只是沒有人明明的講論他，因爲怕猶太人。

sentences.english: There are five speeches by Jesus in Matthew.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌在馬太福音中做了五次講論。

sentences.english: Do you mean to correct what I say, and treat the words of a despairing man as wind?
sentences.chinese: 絕望人的講論既然如風，你們還想要駁正言語麼。

sentences.english: Moses gave three speeches to his people just before he died.
sentences.chinese: 摩西在離世前對以色列人說了三篇講論。

sentences.english: In what ways does the food Jesus spoke of provide us with spiritual refreshment?
sentences.chinese: 耶穌講論的事物在哪些方面提供我們屬靈的更新？

sentences.english: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
sentences.chinese: 絕望人的講論既然如風，你們還想要駁正言語嗎。

sentences.english: The subject of today's talk is interviews.
sentences.chinese: 來日誥日講論的話題是裏試。

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
respect for the wise
to observe the ritual mourning
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
conclusion/judgment/verdict
extinct
historical biography
